metadata.synopsis: A Chicago train-station shoeshine boy (Gary Coleman) becomes famous for his knack of picking racehorses.

reviews: On the Right Track' is a vehicle for Mr. Coleman that depends entirely on the premise that he is lovable. Only his most ardent television fans are likely to accept this.
Other than a few cute lines and situations, there's little else of value in this absurd and extremely naive picture.

What could have been a bright little comedy is so jampacked with supporting players, subplots, and distractions that it seems much longer than it is, and even Coleman's fortitude doesn't get us through.
